sentences.sContent: The riot was precipitated when four black men were arrested.
sentences.sCn: 这场骚乱是因为四名黑人男子的被捕而突然引发的。

sentences.sContent: I don't think we should make precipitate decisions.
sentences.sCn: 我认为我们不应该做出仓促的决定。

synos.tran: [化学]使沉淀；促成；猛抛；使陷入
[化学]沉淀；猛地落下；冷凝成为雨或雪等
突如其来的；猛地落下的；急促的

words.tran: 勇往直前的；急促的；突如其来的
起沉淀作用的；急落的；猛冲的
[化学] 沉淀，[化学] 沉淀物；冰雹；坠落；鲁莽
[化学] 沉淀剂，[矿业] 沉淀器；催促的人

trans.tranOther: a solid substance that has been chemically separated from a liquid

trans.tranCn: 使沉淀；促成；猛抛；使陷入
trans.tranOther: to make something serious happen suddenly or more quickly than was expected

trans.tranCn: 突如其来的；猛地落下的；急促的
trans.tranOther: A precipitate action or decision happens or is made more quickly or suddenly than most people think is sensible
